articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The Gary Vee-backed startup continues its shift beyond sports-themed collectibles.
articles.title: NFT Startup Candy Digital Taps Getty Images for '70s Music and Photos

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: Karine Jean-Pierre refused to comment on the specifics of Silvergate’s situation, pointing to recent regulatory guidelines issued to US banks.
articles.title: White House Will ‘Continue Monitoring’ Silvergate Bank Reports: Press Secretary

articles.author: Andrew Cohen
articles.description: Another popular project leaves the blockchain once called the "Ethereum killer."
articles.title: Blockasset Athlete NFTs Drop Solana for Chiliz Sports Platform

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The company’s collection of 300 generative art pieces garnered over 3,000 bids in 24 hours.
articles.title: Yuga Twelvefold Bitcoin NFT Auction Raises $16.5 Million

articles.author: Ryan Ozawa
articles.description: Whether or not it's novel, it's another Bitcoin tool inspired by Ordinals.
articles.title: What is a Sovereign Rollup? Rollkit Pitches Second Layer for Bitcoin

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: After a legal victory against the NFT collection for trademark infringement, Hermès is asking a judge to force the collection offline permanently.
articles.title: Hermès Seeks Stronger Block of MetaBirkins NFT Sales

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The securities regulator has until tomorrow morning to come up with a more convincing argument against Voyager’s restructuring plan.
articles.title: Voyager Bankruptcy Judge Has Harsh Words for SEC's Objection to Binance Deal

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The FTX aliffiliate claims that Grayscale’s “improper” fund freeze means that customer cash has been lost.
articles.title: Alameda Sues Grayscale Over $9 Billion Locked in Bitcoin Trust Shares

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The U.S. trustee appointed by the Department of Justice in the FTX bankruptcy case has filed an appeal in support of an independent examiner.
articles.title: Justice Department Pushes for Independent Investigation of FTX Collapse

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Fireblocks Web3 lead Omer Amsel says bear markets lead to better products.
articles.title: Crypto Market Cycles Are the 'Main Driver' of Industry Innovation: Fireblocks Web3 Lead

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The investment advisor allegedly commingled customer funds and used millions to make "Ponzi-like payments."
articles.title: SEC Shuts Down '$100 Million Crypto Fraud' in Miami

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: As meme coin promoter Musk turns his attention from crypto to AI, Dogecoin appears to bearing the brunt of this week's losses.
articles.title: Dogecoin Drops 10% on the Week as Elon Musk Turns Attention to AI

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.author: Will McCurdy
articles.description: Despite recent crypto layoffs, prospects for blockchain developers may be set to hold strong according to some in the hiring industry.
articles.title: Demand for Blockchain Devs Is Soaring—But Not Just in Crypto

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Embattled crypto broker Babel Finance is exploring the launch of a new DeFi token to resolve the company’s financial woes.
articles.title: Babel Finance Mulls New Token Launch to Repay Creditors

articles.author: Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: Yuga Labs' Bitcoin-based NFT offering implements a primitive auction technique to launch the TwelveFold NFT collection.
articles.title: Critic Says Yuga Labs Bitcoin NFTs Auction Sets 'Really Bad Precedent’

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The U.S. Attorney submitted a new request to limit the websites and online services Sam Bankman-Fried can use.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Wants to Watch Netflix and Read Crypto News While Awaiting Trial

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Neal Stephenson believes creators are key to building “priceless” things that people will HODL.
articles.title: User-Generated Content Can Stabilize Digital Economies, Says ‘Snow Crash’ Author

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The April upgrade promises more competitive trading fees and improved liquidity provisioning.
articles.title: PancakeSwap Version 3 Is Coming to BNB Smart Chain

articles.description: A Telegram group chat reveals the Binance team's skittishness over regulatory scrutiny.
articles.title: Binance Team Fretted Over Binance US Ties, Tried to Recruit Gary Gensler: WSJ

articles.description: Visa’s head of crypto this week emphatically denied that the payments giant was pausing its crypto push.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Lawyers Lay Into SEC, Elon Musk Cools on Crypto

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Crypto donations still buoy humanitarian relief efforts in disaster and war zones.
articles.title: Charitable Crypto Giving Continues Through Bear Market

articles.description: The IMF’s managing director this week told a journalist that banning crypto “should not be taken off the table.”
articles.title: This Week in Coins: First Two Weeks of Straight Losses in 2023, Bitcoin and Ethereum Dip

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Jesse Pollak says the publicly traded crypto exchange will continue to push the envelope.
articles.title: Coinbase ‘Iterating Quickly’ on NFT Marketplace Despite Lackluster Rollout: Protocols Head

articles.description: Supermodular picks up where Gitcoin Holdings left off.
articles.title: Gitcoin Co-Founder Kevin Owocki Unveils ReFi Incubator Supermodular

articles.description: "It seemed like a logical assumption at the time that would be the the output device" for the metaverse, Stephenson said. "But that's not what happened."
articles.title: 'Snow Crash' Author Neal Stephenson Says Future of the Metaverse Won't Require Goggles

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: With Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade slated for April, ETH stakers will finally be able to withdraw their holdings. But will they sell?
articles.title: Just 16% of Ethereum Stakers Are in Profit Ahead of Shanghai Upgrade

articles.description: Just as the market cap for Binance’s stablecoin BUSD has plunged double digits in the past month, another competitor is on the rise.
articles.title: Market Cap for Binance Stablecoin BUSD Plummets 43% in 30 Days

articles.description: A Friday WSJ report claims the stablecoin issuer had some shadowy backers.
articles.title: Tether Used Fake Documents to Open Bank Accounts: WSJ

articles.description: A report released Friday by analysts suggests that Bitcoin Ordinals’ wild run of the last month is only just the beginning.
articles.title: Bitcoin NFT Market to Hit $4.5 Billion by 2025: Galaxy

articles.description: It’s getting tougher to buy and sell crypto if you bank in the U.K. These are the latest rules.
articles.title: UK Crypto Crackdown: Which British Banks Allow You to Buy Bitcoin?

articles.description: Regulation may be headed for the NFT market, but Sorare CEO Nicolas Julia says new frameworks are needed.
articles.title: Sorare NFTs Should Be Regulated Under 'New Category', CEO Says

articles.description: Mass adoption of music NFTs doesn't appeal to electronic music pioneer DJ Agoria. For him, the rarer the better.
articles.title: 'I Don’t Trust in Music NFTs': French Electronic Producer DJ Agoria

articles.description: The crypto exchange will integrate with the cross-chain layer 2 solution linking Ethereum, Tron and BNB Chain.
articles.title: Huobi to Join BitTorrent Chain Ecosystem, Build Blockchain 'Super Network'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: A CoinShares analyst said the latest downturn has been “completely different” than in the past thanks to orderly capital markets.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miner Capitulation Has Been 'Completely Different' This Cycle: CoinShares

articles.description: Ameen Soleimani, an early contributor to Tornado, has created a fork that aims to be a better version of the blacklisted Ethereum coin mixer.
articles.title: Tornado Cash Contributor Builds New Privacy Tool—And Hopes It Won’t Trigger the Feds

articles.author: Esat Dedezade,Daniel Phillips,Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: At its core, yield farming is a process that allows cryptocurrency holders to lock up their holdings, which in turn provides them with rewards.
articles.title: What Is Yield Farming? Beginner's Guide

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Bitcoin, Ethereum, and the wider crypto market were hit hard on Friday morning as the industry weighs concerns around embattled Silvergate.
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Plunge as Market Mulls Silvergate Fears

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Sen. Cynthia Lummis and Rep. Patrick McHenry cite the Celsius bankruptcy in refuting an April 2022 bulletin.
articles.title: U.S. Lawmakers Say SEC Directive May Bring “Greater Risk of Loss”

articles.author: Ryan Ozawa
articles.description: "Their books and records are incomplete and, in many cases, totally absent," writes FTX CEO John J. Ray III.
articles.title: Debtors Declare 'Massive Shortfall' in FTX Assets, FTX US Also In the Red

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The network’s much-anticipated Shanghai upgrade, which will enable staked ETH withdrawals, was previously slated for a March release.
articles.title: Ethereum Devs Confirm ETH Staking Withdrawals Pushed to April

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.description: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement—until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.
articles.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity

articles.description: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users

articles.description: Salesforce's Web3 lead Marc Mathieu sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the CRM giant's crypto strategy, why "we had to" embrace Web3, and why the crypto wallet is "the new cookie" online.
articles.title: Salesforce Web3 Lead: Every Brand's Web Site Will Support Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Doodles CEO Julian Holguin, former president of Billboard, sat down with Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the strong vibes at the event and the importance of IRL meetups in Web3, what's next for Doodles and the community, and his prediction that many newer projects won't survive the crypto winter.
articles.title: Doodles CEO: Why In-Person Meetups Are Crucial for NFT Communities

articles.description: SuperRare co-founder Jon Perkins sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the debate over artist royalties, SuperRare's roots in catering to artists, and building through a bear market.
articles.title: SuperRare Co-Founder: We Remain Committed to NFT Artist Royalties

articles.description: Avalanche founder and Ava Labs CEO Emin Gun Sirer has been working on proof-of-work cryptocurrencies since before Bitcoin (seriously). He talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about how Avalanche avoided FTX and how much damage SBF has done to crypto’s image with VCs, why institutions still aren’t backing away from crypto, why Avalanche will succeed in the long run, and trying to cater to both Wall Street institutions and DeFi degens. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Meet the Brain Behind Avalanche

articles.description: Sebastien Borget, founder and COO of the metaverse realm The Sandbox, sat down wit Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the future of the open metaverse and true digital ownership, what's next for The Sandbox, and its current user numbers and stats.
articles.title: Founder of The Sandbox: 'Essential' to Metaverse That Users Own Their Digital Content

articles.description: Playboy's Web3 lead Liz Suman sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to tell the story of how the 70-year-old magazine brand got into Web3 and preview its upcoming MetaMansion in The Sandbox, which will give special access privileges to those with a Playboy Rabbitar NFT.
articles.title: Playboy's Next Step in Web3: MetaMansion in The Sandbox

articles.description: Dave Broome, CEO of NFT design and production studio Orange Comet, spoke to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how his company takes "large, popular IP" and turns it into NFT content and Web3 worlds around it.
articles.title: Orange Comet CEO: 'We're Trying to Build the Disney of Web3'
